showScoreExcerpt:
"Funny, wise, intriguing, brilliant, and damn crackling good. And as directed by Gold with a fine cast of four it is the speediest 90 minutes on Broadway...The play, in both setting and speech, is a somehow-it-works mash-up of 19th and 21st centuries...The arguments and stories are of their time, yet of ours as well. Just when did Nora slam that doorâ€”1879, 1979, or was it last year?...The discussions and arguments and fights we had back then are still with us, and probably always will be."
